subtopics.title: Introduction to Linear Equations
subtopics.content:
Introduction

Equations are like balance scales — both sides must be equal. When an equation contains only first power of the variable (like x, not x² or x³), it is called a linear equation. Linear equations are very useful in solving real-life problems such as calculating costs, comparing quantities, or finding unknown values.

subtopics.title: Definition of Linear Equations
subtopics.content:
Definition

A linear equation in one variable is an equation that can be written in the form: ax + b = 0 where a and b are real numbers, and a ≠ 0.

Example: 2x + 5 = 11.

subtopics.title: Solving Linear Equations in One Variable
subtopics.content:
Solving Linear Equations

Steps:

  1. Remove brackets (if any).
  2. Simplify both sides.
  3. Collect variable terms on one side and constants on the other.
  4. Simplify to get the value of the variable.

Example: Solve 3x + 7 = 16.

3x = 16 - 7 ⇒ 3x = 9 ⇒ x = 3

subtopics.title: Linear Equations in Two Variables
subtopics.content:
Two Variable Linear Equations

A linear equation in two variables has the form: ax + by + c = 0 where a, b, c are real numbers, and a, b are not both zero.

Example: 2x + 3y = 6.

Solution of such equations is a pair (x, y) that satisfies the equation.

subtopics.title: Graphical Representation
subtopics.content:
Graphing Linear Equations

The graph of a linear equation in two variables is always a straight line.

Example: For x + y = 4, possible solutions are (0,4), (1,3), (2,2), (3,1). Plotting these points gives a straight line.

subtopics.title: Properties of Linear Equations
subtopics.content:
Key Properties

  • Linear equations in one variable have a unique solution.
  • Linear equations in two variables have infinitely many solutions (all points on the line).
  • If two lines intersect, the point of intersection is the common solution.

subtopics.title: Applications of Linear Equations
subtopics.content:
Word Problems

Age problems: If a person's age is 3 years more than twice his son's age, form and solve the equation.

Cost problems: If 2 pens and 3 pencils cost ₹15, write the equation.

Geometry problems: Angles of a triangle can be solved using linear equations.

questions.question: Which of the following is a linear equation in one variable?
questions.explanation: A linear equation in one variable has the form ax + b = 0 where the variable is only to the first power. x + 7 = 12 fits this definition.

questions.question: Which of these points is a solution of 2x + y = 7?
questions.explanation: Substituting (2,3) into 2x + y = 7: 2(2) + 3 = 4 + 3 = 7. This satisfies the equation.

questions.question: The equation of a line parallel to x + y = 4 is:
questions.explanation: Lines are parallel if they have the same coefficients for x and y. x + y = 2 has the same coefficients (1,1) as x + y = 4, so they are parallel.

questions.question: The graph of a linear equation in two variables is always:
questions.explanation: By definition, the graph of a linear equation in two variables is always a straight line.

questions.question: Which equation represents a line parallel to the x-axis?
questions.explanation: A line parallel to the x-axis has a constant y-value, so its equation is of the form y = c, where c is a constant.

questions.question: Which of the following has infinitely many solutions?
questions.explanation: A linear equation in two variables has infinitely many solutions, as each point on the line is a solution. x + y = 5 is such an equation.
